page.title: 14THE PHANTOM FUNERAL
page.content: There is a legend passed on by the villagers who live around the Long Mynd about a{Phantom Funeral} procession. The{Phantom Funeral}is supposed to pass along the{Portway}on the Long Mynd.At the front of the procession were two black horses and behind the hearse travelled a crowd of mourners. Behind them,in a hollow of the road,a crowd used to stand quietly until the procession was out of sight.Then the people would go home and the next day they would remember nothing.The procession started from{Ratlinghope {Church}or from where the people were buried. Behind the hearse walked a group of skeletons who followed the hearse. Nobody would lead the two black horses they would walk by themselves.
